image.altText: A woman with tied back brown hair in a brown top looks upwards as she is helped out of a white van by three men dressed in blue.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson will return to the Supreme Court today to be sentenced for the murders of three relatives and the attempted murder of a fourth. Follow live.

title.children: Judge says Erin Patterson's mushroom cover story a lie as sentencing continues

image.altText: A man sitting with the ocean behind him has a slight smile in his hand he holds a black rock.

props.synopsis: He has the chic of a Silicon Valley tech bro and a clean energy pitch for investors, but will Gerard Barron's deep-sea mining dream do more harm than good?

title.children: He's been called Australia's Elon Musk. This is his 'trillion-dollar' plan

image.altText: Hume, wearing a white blazer and shirt against a white background.

props.synopsis: The Liberal senator says she was left in shock after her name was invoked in a threat from a senior colleague to Jacinta Nampijinpa Price. Follow live.

title.children: Hume in 'shock' after being named in threat to Price

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: New protections for travellers in government sights
Hume in 'shock' after she was named in threat to Price
Joyce calls on Price to apologise

image.altText: Woman in black blazer and green shirt stands against white wall

props.synopsis: There is open despair inside the Liberal party about how to rebuild its standing in multicultural communities after Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's inflammatory comments about Indian migrants.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price saga shows challenge ahead for Liberals

image.altText: A young man wearing a puffer jacket smiles while holding a red shoe.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed as he made his way home from playing basketball is being mourned as police investigate the fatal stabbing of two children in Melbourne's outer-west on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Beautiful' young man among pair mourned after fatal Melbourne attacks

image.altText: Woman with dark hair smiles with mouth closed

props.synopsis: When Louisa Ioannidis was found dead in a creek, police found no suspicious circumstances. But Louisa’s brother had his doubts, and now a legal team has found compelling new evidence that the case should be reopened.

title.children: 'Hallmarks of something suspicious': How could a 24yo drown in knee-high water?

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz kisses a trophy

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz wins the men's US Open, reclaiming his world number one ranking by defeating Jannik Sinner.

title.children: Alcaraz wins US Open over Sinner, reclaims world number one ranking

image.altText: Donald Trump points

props.synopsis: Donald Trump receives a mixed reaction at the US Open after security delays frustrate fans ahead of the Jannik Sinner vs Carlos Alcaraz men's singles final.

title.children: Trump receives mixed reaction at US Open after security delays frustrate fans

image.altText: A man with a bandaged arm sits in front a tent across from a boy

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians are being told to immediately leave Gaza City, as the Israeli military's campaign to take over and occupy the area intensifies by the hour.

title.children: Palestinians in Gaza City consider evacuating for their children's sake

image.altText: Anti-immigration rally Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's Neo-Nazis sought to make their own message out of anti-immigration marches, and they succeeded.

title.children: Australia's Neo-Nazis have had an unadulterated propaganda win

image.altText: A Ukrainian woman wearing a green top and jacket crying and standing in front of a bomb-destroyed smoking building

props.synopsis: Russia has attacked Kyiv with more than 800 drones in the largest aerial bombardment on Ukraine since the war between the two nations began, killing at least four people.

title.children: Kyiv hit by war's biggest drone attack as Trump threatens Russia with tariffs

image.altText: A close up of Tom Phillips' face.

props.synopsis: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police at a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

title.children: NZ fugitive on the run for four years shot dead during store burglary

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Another batch of weak US jobs data saw global markets retreat on Friday. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slide set to continue after Wall St slipped on weak US jobs figures

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: EV Resources in trading halt pending acquisition announcement
ASX 200 changes sees DroneShield added and Lifestyle Communities cut
Trump's Fed chair shortlist includes White House advisor

image.altText: A woman standing in a warehouse with hi-vi jacket

props.synopsis: Cosmetics entrepreneurs through to tech developers say Austrade's signature export grant has become unfair, badly managed and opaque, all while many are struggling to adjust to Donald Trump's US tariffs.

title.children: Exporters angry over Austrade grant 'disaster'

image.altText: China Sols GIFTS

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese begins a long Pacific tour this week ahead of the Pacific Islands Forum meeting in Solomon Islands, as the battle for influence between China and Australia continues to create headlines.

title.children: Pacific leaders to meet amid flurry of 'comical' gift giving

image.altText: Smiling Anthony Falconer in a grey T-shirt, bearded and wearing glasses, background is blurred.

props.synopsis: A local council has awarded nearly half a million dollars' worth of contracts to a builder with a fraught past.

title.children: Man behind multiple company collapses wins $400k council contract

image.altText: A close up of a red and pink moon against a black sky

props.synopsis: Stargazers around the world are dazzled by the sight of a "blood moon" — or total lunar eclipse — with the spectacular sight even visible from Australia.

title.children: Blood moon delights stargazers as total lunar eclipse seen from Australia

image.altText: Four anonymous silhouettes in front of a court building which reads 'Family Court of Australia'.

props.synopsis: From lawyers "maximising fees" to a family report writer's warning that "your case is a murder-suicide waiting to happen", these parents share allegations of their experience in the Family Court of Australia.

title.children: 'Crushing': Parents desperate for changes to family law system

image.altText: Lando Norris in the pits, changing tyres

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has said he has no issues with McLaren calling team orders late in the Italian Grand Prix, allowing his teammate and championship rival to overtake him for second place.

title.children: Piastri obeys orders allowing Norris to reduce his F1 championship lead

image.altText: Albanese and four other men walk down a hallway, the BCA logo visible on material behind them.

props.synopsis: Hinting at a debate on company profits tax, the prime minister will flag his government is looking at "fair and affordable" ways to incentivise investment at an annual address to big business.

title.children: PM flags corporate tax reform in speech to big business

image.altText: Mercury Psillakis takes a selfie of him and his brother who is holding a surfboard

props.synopsis: A childhood friend has described the "heroic" final act of a surfer who steered his friends to safety before being mauled by a shark at Sydney's Northern Beaches on Saturday.

title.children: Friend describes 'heroic' final act of Sydney surfer killed in shark attack

image.altText: A woman, wearing a snorkel and mask under water, next to a massive marlin.

props.synopsis: After a shock cancer diagnosis, Nikki Watt thought she'd never dive again. But now she's broken a spearfishing world record with a huge marlin.

title.children: The Australian woman who spearfished a 162.5kg striped marlin

image.altText: A red, yellow and green bin.

props.synopsis: As more Perth councils bring in a third bin for food waste, some of the early adopters of the so-called FOGO system are just months away from potentially scrapping the system.

title.children: Councils call for state to help save WA food waste bins

image.altText: David Swallow shouts to celebrate a goal in an AFL elimination final.

props.synopsis: Elated Gold Coast fans say "15 years of struggle" are finally paying off for the club, as the Suns look towards a QClash semi against Brisbane this weekend, hailed as a "massive" moment for Queensland footy.

title.children: Queensland fans gear up for 'biggest ever' AFL game

image.altText: Greyhound dogs racing on a track in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Participants at interstate greyhound race meets are showing their support for Tasmania's industry, lobbying the state government to drop its planned greyhound racing ban.

title.children: 'Strong argument': Tasmanian greyhound industry confident ban will be dropped

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses looks up, with a microphone in front of him

props.synopsis: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba quits to avoid a split within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party.

title.children: Japan's PM resigns amid mounting pressure and a historic election defeat

image.altText: A larger portrait of a teenage boy sits before a crowd of Catholic clergy in white robes and pink skull caps.

props.synopsis: Carlo Acutis, an Italian teenager who died in 2006, becomes the first saint of the internet age.

title.children: First millennial saint canonised by Pope Leo at the Vatican

image.altText: Black and dark grey smoke clouds rising above an airport terminal building, seen from an outdoor car park

props.synopsis: Israeli officials say the Houthis launched multiple drones targeting an area near the Ramon International Airport, closing airspace and forcing a halt to flights.

title.children: Yemen's Houthi rebels launch drone attack on Israeli airport

image.altText: Immigration Raid Hyundai Plant

props.synopsis: South Korea's presidential chief of staff Kang Hoon-sik says the country has finalised negotiations with the Trump administration to release more than 300 workers detained in an immigration raid at a Hyundai plant.

title.children: 'Deal reached' to bring home South Koreans detained in US raids

image.altText: a young man in blue and yellow american football gear in a professional photo

props.synopsis: Growing up in South Australia's Riverland, Jake Stoeckel never imagined one day he would be playing college football for the Kent State Golden Flashes in the United States.

title.children: Player 'with natural kick' switches from Aussie Rules to American football

image.altText: A man with beard smiling in a laboratory with measuring instruments on a table

props.synopsis: They're called '"forever chemicals" because of their extreme durability, but Adelaide researchers say they have developed a new method to combat PFAS.

title.children: Researchers develop new material to help combat 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A skateboarder on the top of a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The city of Canberra may only be 112 years old, but it has many things worth preserving, like a brick skate park in the south, and pine trees and 1960s flats in the north. But there can be hurdles to recognising and preserving heritage as the city grows.

title.children: It accidentally became a skateboarding mecca. Now it's up for heritage listing

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Calls to review drought policy to better help struggling farmers

image.altText: an australian navy warship sails next to a philippine navy ship

props.synopsis: China's military says it followed and warned Australian guided-missile destroyer HMAS Brisbane and a Canadian ship as they transited the sensitive waterway.

title.children: 'Causing trouble': China says it followed Australian ship in Taiwan Strait

image.altText: a student walking on lego

props.synopsis: With an estimated one in five children experiencing chronic pain at some point in their lives, researchers are helping teachers respond to pain in the classroom with empathy.

title.children: Invisible, chronic pain common in kids and a challenge for teachers
